DOC.detailed_description: This study re-examine 2D 3D myocardial perfusion PET data 19 subject , mean age 65 year , mean BMI 30 kg/m2 , 79 % male . Rest stress scan acquire Siemens Accel™ PET scanner 2D ( septum extend ) 3D ( septum retract ) mode . Rb-82 dos rest 53+/-5 mCi stress 53+/-6 mCi . Imaging time 2D emission scan 3 min ( 90 sec delay post Rb-82 infusion ) , follow 3 minute , 3D gate emission scan ( 180 sec delay ) . Decay short acquisition time lead 62 % reduction effective dosage 2D v 3D datasets . 3D image first pre-processed use Monte-Carlo scatter prompt gamma correction algorithm ( Imagen3D™ ) reconstruct use ImagenProTM ( CVIT , Kansas City , MO ) . Reconstructed image evaluate use relative , 17 segment raw score ( Cedars QPET ) . Studies read consensus 2-blinded reader : image quality ( 1-4 , poor-excellent ) , interpretive certainty ( 1-3 , low-high ) rest perfusion use 17 segment model ( 0=normal ; 1-3 = mild , moderate , severe perfusion defect ) . Stress segmental score evaluate due difference image start time post dipyridamole infusion .
